<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rss version="2.0" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">
    <channel>
        <title> Live Science</title>
        <link> http://www.livescience.com</link>
        <description>Science, health & technology news</description>
        <lastBuildDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:41:38 EDT</lastBuildDate>
        <language>en-us</language>
        <image>
            <title>Live Science</title>
            <url>http://www.livescience.com/resources/img/feed-site-logo.jpg?f9114e4</url>
            <link>http://www.livescience.com</link>
            <width>88</width>
            <height>31</height>
        </image>
                    <item>
                <title>Are We Alone? Scientists Discuss the Search for Life and Odds of E.T.</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54734-searching-for-alien-life-are-we-alone.html</link>
                <description>What are the odds that life exists elsewhere in the universe? A scientist and a historian talked recently about updating that estimation, at a major physics meeting.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">space</source>
                <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:40:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/344/original/Messier-83-100519-02-image.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Gluten-Free Diets May Be Risky for Kids</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54732-gluten-free-diet-kids.html</link>
                <description>Putting kids on gluten-free diets even if they don't have celiac disease or a wheat allergy may carry more risks than benefits, experts warned.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 12:00:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/068/958/original/gluten-bread.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>13 Numbers That Rival the Number 13</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54733-13-unlucky-lucky-numbers.html</link>
                <description>Here are 13 other numbers that people have fixated on as lucky, unlucky or just plain evil.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">strange-news</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:35:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/073/959/original/friday-13.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Power Up! Exosuit Helps You Lift Heavy Loads</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54730-robotic-exosuit-helps-people-carry-loads.html</link>
                <description>If you're a soldier, firefighter or even a hiker, a new soft robotic suit could one day help you carry hefty loads, a new study finds.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">technology</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 02:45:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/340/original/exosuit-test.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Alien Megastructure? Dimming Star May Have Less Exotic Explanation</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54728-alien-megastructure-star-telescope-changes.html</link>
                <description>The odd dimming over the course of a century that astronomers detected in the star KIC 8462852 may have resulted not from alien activity, but rather from how telescopes and cameras have changed over time, researchers say.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">space</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 02:26:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/338/original/comets-converging-on-star.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Docs Retrieve Misfit Shine from Girl's Stomach — Device Still Works</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54729-swallow-fitness-tracker.html</link>
                <description>A 13-year-old girl swallowed her Misfit Shine activity tracker while swimming, but the gadget still worked when doctors retrieved it.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 02:23:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/336/original/misfit-shine-swallowed.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Autism: Symptoms, Diagnosis and Treatments</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/34704-autism-symptoms-diagnosis-and-treatments.html</link>
                <description>Autism spectrum disorder affects a person's ability to communicate, interact with others and behave appropriately in social situations.
</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 01:43:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/029/837/original/shutterstock_58652809.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>7 Weird Things People Have Swallowed </title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54727-weird-things-people-swallowed.html</link>
                <description>People have swallowed all sorts of weird objects, from household items to tech gadgets.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 01:15:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/073/501/original/spongebob-x-ray.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Why Belief in Witchcraft Can Do Harm</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54726-belief-in-witchcraft-erodes-trust.html</link>
                <description>Economic development and culture can collide in regions where witchcraft beliefs are common.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">strange-news</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:42:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/327/original/witch-doctor-zimbabwe.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Giant Pandas and Humans: A Lesson in Sustainability</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54725-how-giant-pandas-and-humans-coexist.html</link>
                <description>If Facebook is any gauge, pandas are an endless font of cute. But revelations about where pandas live and how they coexist with people are boosting their impact beyond more than the warm and fuzzy. </description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">environment</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:11:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/182/original/pandas-5-snooze.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Mystery of Bizarre Radar Echoes Solved, 50 Years Later</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54724-mystery-of-bizarre-radar-echoes-solved.html</link>
                <description>Weird radio echoes that appear at dawn every day over an observatory in Peru have long baffled scientists, until now. </description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">environment</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 08:51:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/323/original/radio-echoes.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Newfound Ax Blade May Be World's Oldest, Researchers Say</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54722-ax-blade-may-be-worlds-oldest.html</link>
                <description>What could be the world's oldest stone ax blade has been identified from fragments found in an ancient rock shelter in northwest Australia, according to archaeologists.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">history</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:26:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/304/original/oldest-axe-1-axe-flakes.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>In Photos: World's Oldest Ax Blade Found in Australia</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54714-worlds-oldest-ax-photos.html</link>
                <description>Archaeologists uncovered what could be the world's oldest stone ax blade in an ancient rock shelter in Australia.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">history</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:26:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/308/original/oldest-axe-5-axe-heads.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Why Texting Isn't Like Other Kinds of Distracted Driving</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54718-distracted-driving-texting-sixth-sense.html</link>
                <description>Your brain can keep you safe behind the wheel — but only to an extent. 
</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 05:00:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/318/original/texting-driving.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Sigmund Freud: Life, Work & Theories</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54723-sigmund-freud-biography.html</link>
                <description>Sigmund Freud was one of the most influential scientists in the fields of psychology and psychiatry. A century after he published his theories, Freud still influences what we think about personality and the mind.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">culture</source>
                <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:27:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/199/original/sigmund-freud.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Chubby Panda Cub 'Bei Bei' Learns to Stare at Tennis Balls</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54721-panda-cub-bei-bei-update.html</link>
                <description>The National Zoo's youngest (and chubbiest) panda cub is learning how to touch a tennis ball with his little black nose, zookeepers say.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">animals</source>
                <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 05:25:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/322/original/bei-bei-panda-cake.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Big Test Pushes Elon Musk's Futuristic 'Hyperloop' Closer to Reality</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54719-hyperloop-one-first-public-test.html</link>
                <description>A futuristic transportation concept known as the "Hyperloop" is undergoing the first public test today of one of its key components — an important milestone for the pioneering system first envisioned by SpaceX and Tesla founder Elon Musk.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">technology</source>
                <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 05:16:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/317/original/hyperloop-test.jpeg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Hyperloop Technology In Testing Phase – Sled and Pod Animation</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54720-hyperloop-technology-in-testing-phase-sled-and-pod-animation.html</link>
                <description>Hyperloop One (formerly Hyperloop Tehnologies) is testing their sled technology on a limited track in the Nevada Desert.  </description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">technology</source>
                <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 05:15:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/319/original/LS_160511_hyperloop_animation.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Memory Eraser: This Trick Helps You Forget</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54717-how-to-forget-a-memory.html</link>
                <description>Bad date? Embarrassing conversation? New research finds a way to forget what we'd rather not remember.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">health</source>
                <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 03:31:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/316/original/woman-forget-memory-160511.jpg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
                    <item>
                <title>Cosmic Dust on Earth Reveals Clues to Ancient Atmosphere</title>
                <link>http://www.livescience.com/54716-space-dust-reveals-clues-ancient-earth-atmosphere.html</link>
                <description>The oldest space dust yet found on Earth suggests that the ancient atmosphere of Earth had significantly more oxygen than previously thought, a new study finds.</description>
                <source url="http://www.livescience.com">environment</source>
                <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 02:40:00 EDT</pubDate>
                                    <media:content type="image/jpeg" url="http://www.livescience.com/images/i/000/083/303/original/archaen-micrometeorite.jpeg?interpolation=lanczos-none&fit=around|160:100&crop=160:100;*,*"/>
                            </item>
            </channel>
</rss>
